elements.title: John Company (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the box cover of the board game John Company shows Georgiana, Duchess of Devonshire, and George, Prince of Wales, gambling at hazard (pictured)?

elements.title: Premana Premadi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Premana Premadi is the first Indonesian female astronomer to have an asteroid named in her honor?

elements.title: No Highs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the album No Highs is a response to the "corporate" ambient music of streaming services?

elements.title: Myriel Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that telephone operator Myriel Davies began her long career as a peace activist during the Suez Crisis?

elements.title: Native Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New Zealand's Native Island hosted a colony of Samoyeds and huskies used in both the Southern Cross and Nimrod expeditions to the South Pole?

elements.title: a deadly shooting (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the suspect in a deadly shooting at the University of North Carolina was a graduate student of the victim?

elements.title: A Rustling of Leaves: Inside the Philippine Revolution (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sound for the film A Rustling of Leaves: Inside the Philippine Revolution was recorded using a Walkman?

elements.title: Milverine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a man from Milwaukee who goes on walks shirtless is known as the "Milverine"?
